meanings.definition: A learning disorder that affects reading, writing, and spelling.
meanings.sent1: Dyslexia can make it hard to read books.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with dyslexia when trying to write essays.
meanings.sent3: The dyslexia made the words on the page dance around.
meanings.sent4: His dyslexia turned the letters into a jumbled puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher helped the student with dyslexia sound out each word slowly.

meanings.definition: Difficulty with language processing and decoding written words.
meanings.sent1: Her dyslexia caused confusion when trying to understand sentences.
meanings.sent2: The child's dyslexia made it challenging to decipher the text.
meanings.sent3: The dyslexia played tricks on her mind, mixing up the letters.
meanings.sent4: His dyslexia was like trying to solve a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The dyslexia made the words on the page look like a foreign language.

meanings.definition: Impairment in the ability to recognize and comprehend written words.
meanings.sent1: Dyslexia can make it hard to recognize familiar words.
meanings.sent2: The student's dyslexia hindered their ability to understand the text.
meanings.sent3: The dyslexia made the words on the page play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her dyslexia was like trying to read a book in a fog.
meanings.sent5: The dyslexia created a barrier between the reader and the words on the page.
